author: Maria Akram
text:
Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejiwal on completion of one year in office announced a waiver on pending water bill till November 30, 2015. Mr. Kejriwal while presenting his report card of achievements in the first year and the future plans on Sunday said that they have not let a single penny of taxpayers’ money go “waste”.

The Chief Minister, who addressed a press conference , announced re-implementation of the Delhi government’s scheme of 80 per cent reduction in one-time sewer and water development charges for new connections. During the first phase of implementation of this scheme, from June 26 to September 25, last year, the Delhi Jal Board had registered 1.5 lakh new water connections, he said.

Mr. Kejriwal said that despite subsidy, the Delhi Jal Board has Rs. 176 crore surplus and by the end of this year, all of Delhi will get piped water.
title: Kejriwal govt. waives water bills
